events.description: Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves fell to USD 154.6 billion from a nine-month high.
Measures implemented by Bank Indonesia to stabilize the rupiah amid global market uncertainty.

facts.fact_text: Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves stood at USD 154.6 billion in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Indonesia’s foreign exchange reserves declined to USD 154.6 billion in January 2026

facts.fact_text: Foreign exchange reserves in December were USD 156.5 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: down from a nine-month high of USD 156.5 billion in December

facts.fact_text: The reserve level covers 6.3 months of imports.

evidences.evidence_text: The current level is sufficient to cover 6.3 months of imports

facts.fact_text: The international adequacy benchmark for reserves is approximately three months of imports.

evidences.evidence_text: well above the international adequacy benchmark of around three months of imports

claims.claim_text: The decline in reserves was primarily caused by government debt payments and currency stabilization.
claims.author: Bank Indonesia

evidences.evidence_text: The decline was primarily driven by the government’s foreign debt payments and rupiah exchange rate stabilization measures implemented by Bank Indonesia

claims.claim_text: There is increasing uncertainty in global financial markets.

evidences.evidence_text: in response to rising uncertainty in global financial markets

claims.claim_text: Indonesia's current reserve levels are well above international adequacy standards.

evidences.evidence_text: well above the international adequacy benchmark of around three months of imports

evidence.evidence_text: The decline was primarily driven by the government’s foreign debt payments
The decline was primarily driven by... rupiah exchange rate stabilization measures implemented by Bank Indonesia

links.source_ref: rising uncertainty in global financial markets

evidence.evidence_text: stabilization measures implemented by Bank Indonesia in response to rising uncertainty in global financial markets
The current level is sufficient to cover 6.3 months of imports
